channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Nigerian Nobel winner Wole Soyinka says U.S. revoked his visa after Trump criticism
item.description: Soyinka, the first African to win the Nobel Prize in literature, believes his non-resident visa could have been rejected because he likened President Trump to a former Ugandan dictator.
item.content:encoded:
Soyinka, the first African to win the Nobel Prize in literature, believes his non-resident visa could have been rejected because he likened President Trump to a former Ugandan dictator.

(Image credit: Sunday Alamba)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The East Wing gave women space to thrive in the White House — here's why
item.description: First intended as an entrance for social events, the East Wing became the first lady's office space. Historians say the shift was a key part of professionalizing staff for the president's wife.
item.content:encoded:
First intended as an entrance for social events, the East Wing became the first lady's office space. Historians say the shift was a key part of professionalizing staff for the president's wife.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Kaity Kline

item.title: Trump says South Korea will build a nuclear submarine in the U.S.
item.description: It's unclear what the timeline for such a project would be. The announcement follows trade negotiations between the countries, including Korean investment in U.S. shipbuilding.
item.content:encoded:
It's unclear what the timeline for such a project would be. The announcement follows trade negotiations between the countries, including Korean investment in U.S. shipbuilding.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: What Wikipedia and Grokipedia are saying about each other
item.description: Elon Musk's new online encyclopedia aims to challenge Wikipedia, which he has accused of left-leaning bias. We used them to search for data about each other.
item.content:encoded: Elon Musk's new online encyclopedia aims to challenge Wikipedia, which he has accused of left-leaning bias. We used them to search for data about each other.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: 'The helpers need help'. Food banks brace for impact as SNAP cliff looms.
item.description: Food banks have already been contending with higher food prices and increased need. Administrators say demand will skyrocket if federal nutrition benefits stop in a few days because of the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
Food banks have already been contending with higher food prices and increased need. Administrators say demand will skyrocket if federal nutrition benefits stop in a few days because of the government shutdown.

(Image credit: Barbara Sprunt)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: How will the dismantling of USAID affect U.S. relief efforts in Jamaica?
item.description: USAID was the lead American agency in disaster response. Now that it's been dismantled, questions are arising about how effective U.S. relief efforts will be in Jamaica after the hurricane.
item.content:encoded:
USAID was the lead American agency in disaster response. Now that it's been dismantled, questions are arising about how effective U.S. relief efforts will be in Jamaica after the hurricane.

(Image credit: Chandan Khanna/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: DHS calls for defending American culture. That leaves some Latinos rattled
item.description: DHS's social media campaign promises to defend American identity and culture from an invasion. For many Latinos, it's a message that does not sit well.
item.content:encoded: DHS's social media campaign promises to defend American identity and culture from an invasion. For many Latinos, it's a message that does not sit well.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: White House fires entire commission that reviews designs for federal buildings
item.description: The White House has fired all six members of the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts, the independent federal agency that reviews design plans for monuments, memorials, coins and federal buildings.
item.content:encoded:
The White House has fired all six members of the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts, the independent federal agency that reviews design plans for monuments, memorials, coins and federal buildings.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Teens who use weed before age 15 have more trouble later, a study finds
item.description: Young teens who use cannabis are more likely to be frequent users than people who start later, according to a study in JAMA Network Open. They are also more likely to seek care for health problems.
item.content:encoded:
Young teens who use cannabis are more likely to be frequent users than people who start later, according to a study in JAMA Network Open. They are also more likely to seek care for health problems.

(Image credit: Sara Ruiz/)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: Israel says it's resuming the ceasefire after its strikes in Gaza kill over 100 people
item.description: Israel's military said the ceasefire in Gaza resumed after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight that killed 104 people, including 46 children, according to local health officials.
item.content:encoded:
Israel's military said the ceasefire in Gaza resumed after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight that killed 104 people, including 46 children, according to local health officials.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
